sub_niche: Smart Home Living & Connected Home Design
status: Lifestyle smart home vertical (distinct from SmartHomeWizards tech focus)

archetype.archetype_expression: The homeowner who integrated smart tech to make their home genuinely better—not just more connected. Values comfort, aesthetics, and family life. Technology serves the home, not the other way around. Makes smart living feel effortless and beautiful.

soul.one_sentence: Technology that makes your home feel more like home—smart living that's actually livable.
soul.expanded: A connected home isn't about having the most gadgets—it's about technology that genuinely improves daily life. We focus on smart home solutions that enhance comfort, safety, and enjoyment without creating tech overwhelm. Beautiful spaces that happen to be intelligent. Family-friendly automation that everyone can use.
soul.what_we_are: Lifestyle-focused smart home guidance. Tech that enhances living. Design-conscious solutions. Family-friendly approaches. Beautiful and smart together.
soul.what_we_are_not: Not tech specs obsession. Not gadget collecting. Not ignoring aesthetics. Not making homes feel like tech labs. Not intimidating complexity.

if_this_site_were.person: A 42-year-old homeowner who loves both beautiful interiors and clever technology. Their home looks magazine-worthy AND is filled with smart conveniences that guests don't immediately notice. Values family comfort and experiences over tech impressiveness. Makes it look effortless.
if_this_site_were.place: A beautiful, warm home that happens to be intelligently connected. Clean lines but comfortable. Tech that's integrated, not displayed. The kind of home where the technology is invisible but the benefits are everywhere. Cozy, modern, inviting.
if_this_site_were.time_of_day: Evening at home—lights automatically dimmed, music playing, temperature perfect, home secure. The golden hour of home life.
if_this_site_were.season: Any—a connected home adapts to all seasons automatically. Cozy in winter, cool in summer.
if_this_site_were.sound: Good music through hidden speakers, maybe a voice assistant responding helpfully. The absence of annoying sounds because the home handles things quietly.
if_this_site_were.texture: Quality home materials, warm fabrics, comfortable furniture, subtle tech. Natural materials meeting modern convenience.
if_this_site_were.smell: A home that smells good because ventilation is smart, not because of air fresheners. Fresh, clean, inviting.
if_this_site_were.taste: Homemade meal, enjoyed with good lighting and music handled automatically. The taste of a well-lived life.
if_this_site_were.temperature: Perfect—because the smart thermostat knows your preferences. Never too hot, never too cold.
if_this_site_were.weather: Handled—the house responds to weather automatically. Blinds adjust, systems adapt.
if_this_site_were.music_genre: Whatever fits the moment—the house knows. Dinner party jazz, morning energy, bedtime calm.
if_this_site_were.movie: Smart House meets Nancy Meyers interiors—intelligent and beautiful, warm and welcoming.
if_this_site_were.book: A home design book where technology is seamlessly integrated, never intrusive.

primary_persona.name: Lifestyle Laura
primary_persona.description: A homeowner who values both style and convenience. Interested in smart home for the lifestyle benefits, not the tech specs. Wants their home to be beautiful AND smart. Doesn't consider themselves 'techy' but loves good design.
primary_persona.mindset: Design-conscious, convenience-seeking, not a techie. Values experience over specs. Wants things that 'just work.'
pain_points: Smart home content is too technical
objections: Can everyone in family use it?
Is this actually easier or just more complicated?
Will it look like a tech lab?

secondary_persona.name: Design-focused David
secondary_persona.description: Interior design enthusiast who wants tech that doesn't compromise aesthetics. Needs solutions that blend in beautifully. Perhaps a designer or design-adjacent professional.
secondary_persona.how_they_differ: Design primary, tech secondary. Needs aesthetic-first recommendations. Will reject anything that compromises style.

tertiary_persona.name: Family-First Fiona
tertiary_persona.description: Parent wanting smart home benefits for the whole family—safety, convenience, even kid-friendly features. Everyone needs to be able to use it.
tertiary_persona.how_they_differ: Family/kid focus, safety priorities, everyone-can-use-it requirement. Practicality for busy family life.

anti_persona.description: Tech enthusiasts who want maximum specs and features. Those who don't care about aesthetics. People who want the most cutting-edge tech regardless of usability or appearance.
anti_persona.why_not: We prioritize livability over tech impressiveness. Design matters as much as function.

visual_philosophy.overall_aesthetic: Warm modern—beautiful homes that happen to be smart. Interior magazine quality.

density.description: Spacious like a well-designed room—not cluttered, room to appreciate beauty
density.never: Never cluttered. Never tech-y. Never cold. Never cramped.

contrast.description: Warm, inviting, magazine-quality interior photography feel
contrast.approach: Light mode, warm tones, quality feel throughout
contrast.never: Never cold. Never sterile. Never harsh. Never clinical.

motion.description: Smooth, subtle, like smart home automation itself—effortless
motion.purpose: To feel effortless, like the smart home experience itself
motion.never: Never flashy. Never tech-demo feeling. Never jarring.

texture.description: Warm home textures—fabric, wood, quality materials feel
texture.never: Never tech-y. Never cold. Never plastic feeling.

shape_language.primary_shapes: Soft modern—clean but warm, inviting curves
shape_language.never: Never sharp/cold. Never industrial. Never aggressive.

depth.approach: Subtle, like good interior design—layered but not dramatic
depth.never: Never harsh shadows. Never flat. Never dramatic depth.

required_flow: Beautiful hero—stunning home interior with smart tech subtly visible
Value proposition—tech that enhances without overwhelming
Room-by-room inspiration—living room, kitchen, bedroom, etc.
forbidden_flow: Spec sheets and comparisons up front

hero_requirements.type: Stunning interior photography with smart tech subtly integrated
hero_requirements.cta_style: Elegant invitation: 'Explore Smart Living', 'Find Inspiration', 'Design Your Haven'

single_posts.related_content_style: Related rooms, complementary ideas, gentle suggestions

spacing_rhythm.breathing_rule: When in doubt, add more space

responsive_philosophy.mobile_approach: Equally beautiful and spacious on mobile

navigation.philosophy: Room-based + lifestyle-based navigation—find by space or by goal

primary_nav.dropdown_behavior: Elegant dropdowns by room or theme

secondary_nav.contents: All rooms, all themes, about, contact

breadcrumbs.style: Subtle: Home > Living Room > Ambient Lighting Ideas

accent.usage: Pull quotes, special callouts, elegant emphasis

gradient_rules.type: None—clean and warm, photography provides visual interest

photography_style.lighting: Beautiful interior photography lighting—natural, warm, inviting
photography_style.color_treatment: Warm, magazine-quality, true to life but elevated
photography_style.mood: Aspirational but achievable, warm, lived-in quality
subjects: Beautiful home interiors with smart tech

illustration_style.approach: Elegant diagrams if needed, home-style illustrations

Every image shows beautiful home first
